channel.description: Recent content in dgraph on Dgraph Blog

item.title: "Dgraph, GraphQL, Schemas, and CRUD Summary" from Bill Kennedy
item.description: After learning that Dgraph has native support for GraphQL, Bill Kennedy switched gears and re-wrote his original Dgraph tutorial to show how to use Dgraph with the native GraphQL support.

item.title: Dgraph GraphQL hits GA with v20.03.1
item.description: Dgraph is a distributed, transactional, open source, native graph database. It enables and simplifies the development of scalable cloud applications that continue to thrive even when the data is highly connected and involved.

item.title: Why there would be no Dgraph 2.0: Goodbye Semantic Versioning
item.description: There would be no Dgraph 2.0. After 4+ years of releasing Dgraph, we have decided to switch away from Semantic Versioning.

item.title: Whatâ€™s Next? Learn Dgraph with the Getting-Started Blog Series
item.description: We are excited to announce that the “Get Started with Dgraph” of our documentation site now includes the episodes from our getting started blog series.

item.title: Datetime Indexes in Dgraph
item.description: I recently started working at Dgraph Labs in Bengaluru as a Software Engineer. One of the first issues that I worked on was related to the Dgraph’s datetime datatype.

item.title: Celebrating 10,000 GitHub Stars
item.description: Dgraph is celebrating the milestone of reaching 10,000 GitHub stars ðŸŽ‰. This wouldn’t have happened without all of you, so we want to thank the awesome community for being with us all the way along.

item.title: Migrating data from SQL to Dgraph
item.description: Dgraph is rapidly gaining reputation as an easy to use database to build apps upon. Many new users of Dgraph have existing relational databases that they want to migrate from.

item.title: How Access Control Works in Dgraph
item.description: With GDPR passing in the EU on April 14th, 2016, users on the Internet are demanding protection of their privacy and data from Internet companies.
